t: The Assurance of God’s Saving Work
To the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David.
May*pn the Lord*s answer you in the day of trouble; May*ld the name of the God of Jacob defend you;
May*ld He send you help from the sanctuary, And*ld strengthen you out of Zion;
May*ld He remember all your offerings, And*ld accept your burnt sacrifice. Selah*ipg
May*pn He grant you according to your heart’s desire,*i And*ld fulfill all your purpose.
We*ld will rejoice in your salvation, And*ld in the name of our God we will set up our*i banners! May*ld the Lord*s fulfill all your petitions.
Now*ln I know that the Lord*s saves His anointed; He*ld will answer him from His holy heaven With*ld the saving strength of His right hand.
Some*ln trust*i in chariots, and some in horses; But*ld we will remember the name of the Lord*s our God.
They*ld have bowed down and fallen; But*ld we have risen and stand upright.
Save,*ln Lord!*s May*ld the King answer us when we call.
